page.title: 16Transport
page.content: {Motorcars}take up more room on Edinburgh{roads}and{transport}less than any other form of road traffic,so wasting valuable resources. They also resulted in 38 deaths and 905 injuries in 1983 and account for up to 85% of urban air and noise pollution. The other vehicular possibility for urban Edinburgh travellers is{public {transport}by way of bus.This is important since 65% of vehicle journeys to the city centre are undertaken by public transport whilst only 46% of Lothian households have access to a car.It is more efficient as more people are transported for less fuel on less road space. The car is presently given unfair importance. As expensive new roads, designed for private cars, are planned public transport is restricted.
